direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the set by removing elements based on a collection, but retainAll keeps elements that are in the collection, while removeAll removes elements that are in the collection.
Both methods remove elements from the set, but retainAll uses a collection to determine which elements to keep, while removeIf uses a predicate to determine which elements to remove.
Both methods modify the set by removing elements, but clear removes all elements, while retainAll removes elements not in the specified collection.
Both methods modify the set, but add inserts a single element, while retainAll modifies the set based on a collection of elements.
Both methods modify the set by adding or retaining elements, but addAll inserts all elements from a collection, while retainAll retains elements based on a collection.
retainAll relies on the contains method to determine which elements to retain, making it a critical dependency for the functionality of retainAll.
Both methods remove elements from the set, but remove removes a specific element, while retainAll removes elements not in the specified collection.
Both methods remove elements from the set, but remove(int) removes an element at a specific index, while retainAll removes elements not in the specified collection.
Both retainAll and setOrder.removeIf use predicates to filter and remove elements, sharing a similar control flow and exception handling.
